last_episode_to_air.name: Trust No One
last_episode_to_air.overview: Kathleen makes two of the biggest discoveries of the case. Brendan's lawyers take his case to the next level.

name: Making a Murderer
overview: Filmed over 10 years, this real-life thriller follows a DNA exoneree who, while exposing police corruption, becomes a suspect in a grisly new crime.

episodes.name: Eighteen Years Lost
episodes.overview: When Steven Avery is freed from a wrongful conviction, his search for justice raises questions about the authorities who put him behind bars.

episodes.name: Turning the Tables
episodes.overview: As Steven starts creating a new life for himself, he pursues a lawsuit against Manitowoc County law enforcement officials for corruption in his case.

episodes.name: Plight of the Accused
episodes.overview: Steven is back in jail, charged with murder, but there are troubling questions about how he was arrested and why.

episodes.name: Indefensible
episodes.overview: An unexpected confession casts doubt on Steven's role in the murder case, but the new suspect gives conflicting accounts of what occurred.

episodes.name: The Last Person to See Teresa Alive
episodes.overview: As Steven's trial begins, his attorneys argue that law enforcement officials framed him and were negligent in not pursuing other leads in the case.

episodes.name: Testing the Evidence
episodes.overview: Steven's attorneys cross-examine forensic experts about contaminated evidence and the absence of proof linking Steven to the crime.

episodes.name: Framing Defense
episodes.overview: As the murder trial continues, Steven's attorneys present their case that law enforcement officials planted evidence to frame him.

episodes.name: The Great Burden
episodes.overview: After two long days of closing arguments, the jury deliberates. Steven's fate hinges on whether the jury believes police misconduct may have occurred.

episodes.name: Lack of Humility
episodes.overview: Steven's trial is over, but a new one is just beginning. Will the jury find the suspect's confession or his conflicting statements more believable?

episodes.name: Fighting for their Lives
episodes.overview: In the years after Steven and Brendan's very public trials, the various members of the Avery family struggle to mend their broken lives.

episodes.name: Number 18
episodes.overview: Powerhouse lawyer Kathleen Zellner offers to take Steven's case. Brendan's postconviction lawyers fight in federal court to try to get him released.

episodes.name: Words and Words Only
episodes.overview: Brendan's lawyers work to prove his conviction was based on a coerced confession. Kathleen tests Steven in new ways and visits the alleged crime scene.

episodes.name: A Legal Miracle
episodes.overview: Kathleen's forensic experts review the evidence found in Steven's burn pit. A 1996 statute limits Brendan’s chances of success in federal court.

episodes.name: Welcome to Wisconsin
episodes.overview: Cautiously optimistic, Brendan and his family wait to hear important news about his case. Kathleen files a motion for new scientific testing.

episodes.name: What + Why = Who
episodes.overview: Searching for evidence of tampering, Kathleen visits Steven’s trailer. A new twist in Brendan's case sends his family on an emotional roller coaster.

episodes.name: Everything Takes Time
episodes.overview: Kathleen obtains access to some of the original physical evidence from the case. The former prosecutor holds a press conference.

episodes.name: Item FL
episodes.overview: Kathleen runs new tests on the bullet believed to have killed Teresa Halbach and tracks Teresa's movements on the day she disappeared.

episodes.name: Special Care
episodes.overview: Kathleen uncovers evidence about one of the State's star witnesses. Brendan's case takes another unexpected turn.

episodes.name: Friday Nite
episodes.overview: A witness comes forward with new information about Teresa's car. Kathleen attempts to build the timeline of what happened to Teresa on Oct. 31, 2005.

episodes.name: Trust No One
episodes.overview: Kathleen makes two of the biggest discoveries of the case. Brendan's lawyers take his case to the next level.
